alert.note: Alert for Bond; Clinton; Madison; Monroe; St. Clair; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 2:01PM CST until February 22 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Clinton County in south central Illinois... Southwestern Bond County in south central Illinois... Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern Madison County in southwestern Illinois... Northwestern Washington County in south central Illinois... St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois... * Until 300 PM CST. * At 200 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Brooklyn to near Centreville to near Fountain, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... East St. Louis, Centreville, Washington Park, Madison, Fairmont City and Alorton around 205 PM CST. Belleville, Collinsville, Fairview Heights and Swansea around 210 PM CST. Shiloh and Caseyville around 215 PM CST. O`Fallon, Troy, Maryville, Lebanon, Scott AFB and Smithton around 220 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Freeburg, New Athens, Mascoutah, Trenton, St. Jacob, Aviston, Highland, New Baden, St. Rose and New Memphis. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 24 and 36. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 9 and 41. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri.
